subtitle: the first book of Adam and Eve also
called the conflict of Adam and Eve was
Satan's present-day controversy that
rages around the authenticity of the
scriptures and all human life began on
this planet must pause to consider the
Adam and Eve story where does it come
from what does it mean the familiar
version in Genesis is not the source of
this fundamental legend it is not a
spontaneous heaven-born account that
sprang into place in the Old Testament
it is simply a version on Excel perhaps
but a version of a myth or belief or
account handed down by word of mouth
from generation to generation of mankind
through the incoherent unrecorded ages
of man it came like an inextinguishable
ray of light that ties the time when
human life began with the time when the
human mind could express itself and the
human hand could riot
this is the most ancient story in the
world it is survived because it embodies
the basic fact of human life a fact that
has not changed one iota amid all the
superficial changes of civilizations of
vivid array this fact remains the
conflict of good and evil the fight
between man and devil the eternal
struggle of human nature against sin but
the Adam and Eve story pervaded the
thoughts of ancient writers as seen in
the large number of versions that exist
or whose existence may be traced through
the writings of Greeks Syrians Egyptians
abyss Ian's Hebrews and other ancient
people as a lawyer might say who
examined so much apparently unrelated
evidence there must be something back of
it the version which we give here is the
work of unknown Egyptians the lack of
historical allusion makes it impossible
to date the writing parts of this
version are found in the Talmud the
Quran and elsewhere showing what a vital
role it played in the original
literature of human wisdom the Egyptian
author first wrote an Arabic which may
be taken as the original manuscript and
that found its way for the south and was
translated into Ethiopia for the present
English translation we are indebted to
dr. SC Malin vicar of brahs wonder who
worked from the ethiopia condition
edited by dr.
trump professor of the University of
Munich dr. Trump had the advantage of
the Arabic original which makes our
bridge
the gap of many centuries the direct one
the reading of these books is an
adventure you'll find the mind of man
fed by the passions hopes fears new
strange earthly existence riding
unrestrained in the zest of
self-expression you roam in the realm of
mythology where swiftly the aspects of
nature assumes manifold personalities
and the amorphous instinct of sin takes
on the grotesqueness of a visible devil
from such a magic of surroundings you
find yourself suddenly staring at
commonplace unvarnished events of family
life and such a family as the first
earthly family was they had all the
troubles all the petty disagreements and
the taking sighs is one another and the
bother moving and stained with a baby
that in total Mark family life today you
will see it when you pee beneath the
overlaying glamour of tradition one
critic has said of this writing this is
we believe the greatest literary
discovery that the world is known its
effect upon contemporary thought and
molding the judgment of the future
generations is of incalculable value the
treasures of Tutankhamun's tomb were no
more precious to the Egyptians then are
these literary treasures to the world of
scholarship but we prefer to let the
reader make his own exploration and form
his own opinion the writing is arresting
enough to inspire very original thoughts
concerning it in general this account's
